title: Abdominal Wound
summary: Emergency care for open abdominal wounds, including those with exposed internal organs (evisceration).

steps.title: Call 911 Immediately
steps.description: This is a life-threatening emergency. Call emergency services immediately. Keep the person as still as possible and do not give them anything to eat or drink.

steps.title: Position the Person
steps.description: Help the person lie on their back. If conscious and no spinal injury is suspected, place a pillow or rolled blanket under their knees to reduce tension on the abdomen. Keep them still.

steps.title: Do Not Push Organs Back In
steps.description: If internal organs are visible outside the body (evisceration), do not attempt to push them back inside. Do not touch the exposed organs directly.

steps.title: Cover the Wound
steps.description: Cover exposed organs with a moist, sterile dressing or clean cloth soaked in clean water. If no sterile materials available, use the cleanest material you have. Then cover with plastic wrap or aluminum foil to retain moisture.

steps.title: Secure the Covering
steps.description: Tape or bandage the covering in place without applying pressure to the wound or organs. The goal is to protect the organs from drying out and further contamination. Ensure the covering is secure but not tight.

steps.title: Treat for Shock and Monitor
steps.description: Cover the person with blankets to maintain body temperature. Monitor breathing and pulse. Keep them calm and reassure them help is coming. Do not raise their legs as this increases abdominal pressure.

warnings: Never attempt to push exposed organs back into the body
Do not apply direct pressure to exposed organs
Do not give the person anything to eat or drink
Do not remove any impaled objects from the abdomen
whenToSeekHelp: This is always a critical emergency requiring immediate professional help
Call 911 immediately - this requires emergency surgery
Keep the person as still as possible until help arrives
preventionTips: Wear seat belts properly positioned across the hips
Use appropriate safety equipment when using tools or machinery
Store knives and sharp objects safely
Maintain good lighting and clear pathways to prevent falls
